I did not tape the sessions.=A0 I will try that.=A0 I was basically just ge=
ntly starting into it.=A0 I am going to RS today to get a patch cord for my=
 recorder to my PC.=A0 Then I can upload the sessions and listen and manipu=
late it if I need to hear certain areas better.=A0 Thanks for the tip. - Co=
zy




________________________________
From: "SnowfireL@..." <Snowfire=
L@...>
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Friday, August 14, 2009 9:10:3=
8 AM
Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Training?

=A0 


_____________________________=
___

did you play your file back ?=A0 if you recorded it I would bet there =
was all kinds of info on it, sometimes they start, at least for me, they st=
arted like more evp's=A0 then real time, now they do both, and at times,=A0=
they are all chating at once it seems.=A0 I think they are talking to each =
other, not just to us. sf

In a message dated 8/14/2009 8:53:51 A.M. Easter=
n Daylight Time, cozykat2003@ yahoo.com writes:
=A0 
>I have had a couple s=
essions now and still have not heard anything.=A0 I am wondering too if the=
 spirits are still listening to me and letting me get my "feet wet" before =
they will speak to me.=A0 I have been polite and have used both AM and FM b=
ands.=A0 I tell them who I am, the day, time and location.=A0 I let them kn=
ow my purpose for communicating and I ask for their help.=A0 I am being pat=
ient with the process.
>
>
>
>
________________________________
From: mrsca=
ptainjack2 <jjkamp@netzero. com>
>To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
>Sent: Frida=
y, August 14, 2009 1:38:17 AM
>Subject: [EVP-ITC] Training?
>
>=A0 
>Thanks=
 so much, Misty. I will see if I can ask them to speak as one, because I th=
ink you hit the nail right on the head -- I do hear them speaking over each=
 other, half in male, half in female, so maybe things would improve like yo=
u said if they organized into one collective voice. Can they still answer q=
uestions about individuals this way, or are you limited to generalized quer=
ies?
>
>Regarding your statement: "Quite often when a new speaker
>comes fo=
rth a bit of a training session can be heard for how they can
>speak so tha=
t my physical self can hear what is said." So by this, do you mean it's pos=
sible it takes a couple of sessions for the entity to master this new metho=
d of communication? For instance, I got my grandmother' s name (among other=
s) during Tuesday's session, but she said nothing, wouldn't answer our ques=
tions; Wednesday, she suddenly started talking and was the primary person w=
e communicated with, even correctly answered my mother's questions about he=
r childhood pets. Could this be because there's a learning curve involved w=
ith talking through the radio? Does it take a session or two before they "g=
et the hang of it"? Or is it all dependent on my skills?
>
>Oh, and wanted =
to say I'm going out tomorrow to buy all the canned goods at the grocery st=
ore in anticipation of the nuclear winter we are about to endure... Just ki=
dding. Hearing about all that stuff they are predicting, it does make me wo=
nder, though, why they would go to such trouble to tell you all that again =
and again -- what's to gain from it? It's not stirring anybody up. 
>
>

<DIV>I have had a couple sessions now and stil=

o me.  I have been polite and have used both AM and FM bands.  I =

rpose for communicating and I ask for their help.  I am being patient =

P>Thanks so much, Misty. I will see if I can ask them to speak as one, beca=
use I think you hit the nail right on the head -- I do hear them speaking o=
ver each other, half in male, half in female, so maybe things would improve=
 like you said if they organized into one collective voice. Can they still =
answer questions about individuals this way, or are you limited to generali=
zed queries?<BR><BR>Regarding your statement: "Quite often when a new speak=
er<BR>comes forth a bit of a training session can be heard for how they can=
<BR>speak so that my physical self can hear what is said." So by this, do y=
ou mean it's possible it takes a couple of sessions for the entity to maste=
r this new method of communication? For instance, I got my grandmother' s n=
ame (among others) during Tuesday's session, but she said nothing, wouldn't=
 answer our questions; Wednesday, she suddenly started talking and was the =
primary person we communicated with, even correctly answered my
 mother's q=
uestions about her childhood pets. Could this be because there's a learning=
 curve involved with talking through the radio? Does it take a session or t=
wo before they "get the hang of it"? Or is it all dependent on my skills?<B=
R><BR>Oh, and wanted to say I'm going out tomorrow to buy all the canned go=
ods at the grocery store in anticipation of the nuclear winter we are about=

g, it does make me wonder, though, why they would go to such trouble to tel=
l you all that again and again -- what's to gain from it? It's not stirring=
